answers.answer: Hello,First of all Lyme’s disease needs to be ruled out. The other possibility for such burning sensation is neuropathy which can be due to pinched nerve also. It is also common in diabetes, hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidism. It can also be due to vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the symptoms are gone or not.In case the symptoms persist then please consult a neurologist as it can be due to some neurological disorder.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: About 2 weeks ago I had redness at the top head of my penis that had a burning sensation.  It didn't hurt or burn when I pee.  It did look like bumps on the head then little dots but I think it was always there but now am freaking out.  I put hyrocortizone cream on it and the next  day the burning sensation went to the bottom of my feet . The next day it went to the top of my feet. The burning sensation was gone for about 1 day then it went to my ankles then knee caps.  It seem to be going throughout my body.  It normally goes away when I sleep.  What could this be?  The bottom of my feet are peeling also.  Memorial day weekend a tick bit me and I found it on my waste the next morning.  I took it off and went to the hospital the tick was still alive.  I don't know if its lyme disease, hiv , or what please help
title: redness top of penis
